sen.j: 伊達 邦成（だて くにしげ、天保12年10月28日 (旧暦)（1841年12月10日） - 明治37年（1904年）11月29日）は、日本の華族。
sen.e: Kunishige DATE (December 10, 1841-Nobember 29, 1904) was the peerage in Japan.
Kunishige DATE (December 10, 1841 - November 29, 1904) was a peerage in Japan.
sen.cmt: スペースを追加しました。文法、スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: Kunishige DATE (December 10, 1841 - November 29, 1904) was a peerage in Japan.
His main name was Fujiwara clan.
His main name was the Fujiwara clan.
His main name was the Fujiwara clan.

sen.j: 家系は伊達朝宗を祖とする伊達氏の分家で、仙台藩一門・亘理伊達家の十五代目。
sen.e: He was the fifteenth in Watari Date family, a family in Sendai Domain and a branch family of Date clan deriving from Tomomune DATE.
He was the 15th head in the Watari Date family in the Sendai Domain which was a branch family of the Date clan deriving from Tomomune DATE.
sen.cmt: 文法、表現を変更しました。
sen.e: He was the 15th head in the Watari Date family in the Sendai Domain which was a branch family of the Date clan deriving from Tomomune DATE.
His peerage was baron.
His peerage was Baron.
sen.cmt: 大文字表記にしました。
sen.e: His peerage was Baron.
His medals for merit was Fourth Class of Order.
He was decorated with the Fourth Class of Order of Merit.
He was decorated with the Fourth Class of Order of Merit.

sen.j: 始祖は伊達政宗の祖父伊達晴宗（はるむね）の弟（政宗からみれば大叔父）にあたる伊達実元（さねもと）という藩主遠縁の家柄。
sen.e: Kunishige's earliest ancestor was Sanemoto DATE, a brother of Harumune DATE, the grandfather of Masamune DATE (grand-uncle for Masamune), so his family lineage was distantly-related to the lord of domain.

Kunishige's earliest ancestor was Sanemoto DATE, a brother of Harumune DATE, who was the grandfather of Masamune DATE (grand-uncle of Masamune), so his family lineage was distantly-related to the lord of the domain.

Kunishige's earliest ancestor was Sanemoto DATE, a brother of Harumune DATE, who was the grandfather of Masamune DATE (grand-uncle of Masamune), so his family lineage was distantly-related to the lord of the domain.

sen.j: 亘理伊達家の初代当主は政宗の重臣であった伊達成実（しげざね）。
sen.e: The first family head of Watari Date family was Shigezane DATE, who was a senior vassal of Masamune.
The first head of the Watari Date family was Shigezane DATE, who was a senior vassal of Masamune.
sen.cmt: 文法、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: The first head of the Watari Date family was Shigezane DATE, who was a senior vassal of Masamune.

sen.j: 邦成は北海道開拓に功績のあった人物。
sen.e: Kunishige had a great achievement in reclaiming Hokkaido.
Kunishige had a great achievement in reclaiming Hokkaido.
Kunishige had a great achievement in reclaiming Hokkaido.

sen.j: 岩出山伊達家（仙台藩一門）・伊達義監の次男で、亘理伊達家十四代伊達邦実の養子になった。
sen.e: Kunishige was the second son of Iwadeyama Date family (a family in Sendai Domain) Gikan DATE, and was adopted as the son of Kunizane DATE, the fourteenth head of Watari Date family.
Kunishige was the second son of Gikan DATE of the Iwadeyama Date family (a family in the Sendai Domain), and was adopted by Kunizane DATE, the fourteenth head of the Watari Date family.
sen.cmt: 文法、表現を修正しました。
sen.e: Kunishige was the second son of Gikan DATE of the Iwadeyama Date family (a family in the Sendai Domain), and was adopted by Kunizane DATE, the fourteenth head of the Watari Date family.

sen.j: 邦成の「邦」は藩主・伊達慶邦から給わったもの。
sen.e: The word "Kuni" in Kunishige was given by the lord of Sendai Domain Yoshikuni DATE.
The word 'Kuni' in Kunishige was given by the lord of the Sendai Domain, Yoshikuni DATE.
sen.cmt: 記号、文法を修正しました。
sen.e: The word 'Kuni' in Kunishige was given by the lord of the Sendai Domain, Yoshikuni DATE.

sen.j: 通称は靫負、藤五郎、安房。
sen.e: His common name was Yugei, Togoro and Abo.
His common name was Yugei, Togoro and Abo.
His common name was Yugei, Togoro and Abo.

sen.j: 仙台藩の亘理（現、宮城県亘理郡亘理町）の領主で、戊辰戦争では海道筋に出兵。
sen.e: Kunishige was the feudal lord of Watari in Sendai Domain (now Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture), and dispatched troops to the coastal route in Boshin War.
Kunishige was the feudal lord of Watari in Sendai Domain (now Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture), and dispatched troops to the coastal route in Boshin War.
Kunishige was the feudal lord of Watari in Sendai Domain (now Watari Town, Watari County, Miyagi Prefecture), and dispatched troops to the coastal route in Boshin War.

sen.j: 戦いに利あらず、逸早く講和論に転じて講和への道筋をつくった。
sen.e: Considering that chances are against victory, he quickly shifted to the policy of peace, paving the way for peace.
Considering that chances are against victory, he quickly shifted to the policy of peace, paving the way for peace.
Considering that chances are against victory, he quickly shifted to the policy of peace, paving the way for peace.

sen.j: 明治に入ると、多くの家臣を養うことが不可能になり、家老常盤新九郎（田村顕允）の意見により1870年（明治3年）から家臣ほかを率いて北海道に移住、胆振国之内有珠郡、現在の伊達市 (北海道)を開拓した。
sen.e: When the Meiji period started, it became impossible to provide for his many vassals, so that accepting the opinion of the chief retainer Shinkuro TOKIWA (Kenin TAMURA), Kunishige moved to Hokkaido leading his vassals and others from 1870, and reclaimed Usu County, Iburi Province (present-day Date City in Hokkaido).

When the Meiji period started, it became impossible to provide for his many vassals and therefore, accepting the opinion of the chief retainer Shinkuro TOKIWA (Kenin TAMURA), Kunishige moved to Hokkaido leading his vassals and others from 1870, and reclaimed Usu County, Iburi Province (present-day Date City in Hokkaido).

When the Meiji period started, it became impossible to provide for his many vassals and therefore, accepting the opinion of the chief retainer Shinkuro TOKIWA (Kenin TAMURA), Kunishige moved to Hokkaido leading his vassals and others from 1870, and reclaimed Usu County, Iburi Province (present-day Date City in Hokkaido).

sen.j: 開拓の功により、1892年に勲四等瑞宝章を受勲、男爵に叙せられた。
sen.e: Because of his achievement of reclamation, he received a decoration of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon, and was raised to baron.
Because of his achievement of the reclamation, he received a decoration of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon, and was raised to baron.
Because of his achievement of the reclamation, he received a decoration of the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Gold Rays with Neck Ribbon, and was raised to baron.

sen.j: 後に北海道神宮に祀られる。
sen.e: Later on he was deitied in Hokkaido-jingu Shrine.
Later on he was deitied in Hokkaido-jingu Shrine.
Later on he was deitied in Hokkaido-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 岩出山伊達家当主で当別町の基礎を築いた伊達邦直は実兄にあたる。
sen.e: Kuninao DATE, who was the family head of Iwadeyama Date family and laid foundation of Tobetsu Town, was his real brother.
Kuninao DATE, who was a head of the Iwadeyama Date family and laid foundation of Tobetsu Town, was his real brother.
Kuninao DATE, who was a head of the Iwadeyama Date family and laid foundation of Tobetsu Town, was his real brother.
